intro: Scottellia kamerunensis, commonly known as the Cameroon scottellia, is a flowering plant native to Cameroon in Central Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
